body_html:
So... I think what is happening is that the placement algorithm goes something like this:

pass A
1) for each node check if it has already been placed (not by the user but by the algorithm)
2) defer 'generator nodes' to a later pass
3) place nodes according to possible placements (according to GetDevicesForNodes - which is where the explict user-specified location comes in)

pass B
1) place generator nodes with their consumers

so generator nodes are not guided by the user's explicit placement commands. the test 'timeline_test' is only valid when the definition of generator nodes does not include nodes which feed more than one consumer. I have changed the definition to include multiple consumer nodes, so the test doesn't work any more.

not sure what to do about this. I could doctor up the test to avoid using generator nodes.

do you have any advice?

body:
So... I think what is happening is that the placement algorithm goes something like this:

```
pass A
1) for each node check if it has already been placed (not by the user but by the algorithm)
2) defer 'generator nodes' to a later pass
3) place nodes according to possible placements (according to GetDevicesForNodes - which is where the explict user-specified location comes in)

pass B
1) place generator nodes with their consumers
```

so generator nodes are not guided by the user's explicit placement commands.  the test 'timeline_test' is only valid when the definition of generator nodes does not include nodes which feed more than one consumer.  I have changed the definition to include multiple consumer nodes, so the test doesn't work any more.

not sure what to do about this.  I could doctor up the test to avoid using generator nodes. 


do you have any advice?
